Masks are mandatory for any individual 11 years old and above in all indoor and outdoor spaces to include public transportation.    Effective September 1, 2021 wearing a mask indoors is mandatory for any individual 11 years old and above,  Wearing a mask outdoors is also mandatory when social distancing is not possible as per the standard 2 meters (~6 feet) distance.  Non-compliance with this rule may result in a fine up to 3,000 ALL.    https://web.archive.org/web/20211211025324/https://al.usembassy.gov/updates_covid19/

http://web.archive.org/web/20211214031917/https://shendetesia.gov.al/1234234234234523523523523431241234-2/  The Ministry of Health appeals to citizens to be vaccinated as soon as possible, to protect themselves and the health of others.  Any citizen over the age of 16 can be vaccinated at the health center or at the nearest centralized vaccination point. AntiCOVID vaccines reduce the chance of infection and greatly avoid hospitalizations and fatalities.  Vaccination is also open for children +12 years old with immune system problems, with a doctor's recommendation. Vaccination with the third dose has also started for all citizens +18 years old who have passed 6 months from the second dose.

On November 11th, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.     The classification for the education sector is risk level III for Lower Austria, Upper Austria and Tyrol and risk level II for all other federal states.     Source: https://archive.vn/Krw7v#selection-541.0-549.153

Nationwide measures  "From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location."    Corona traffic light map  "On November 18, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.   The classification for the education sector is risk level III."    Sources:  https://archive.vn/kqgPP#selection-2225.0-2237.94 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/fnc25 [Corona traffic light map]

Educational area  Meetings for training and further education purposes may only take place for people from the same household. Otherwise, training and further training may only take place for as many people as is necessary.    The schools are open to all who need them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms.    3-G rule also at universities and colleges  The so-called 3-G rule is also used at universities and colleges  . As in other areas of life, those who have been tested, recovered and vaccinated should be granted access to the campus. For this, the current legal basis, the 2nd COVID-19 University Act , will be extended to the coming winter semester 2021/22 until February 28, 2022 and adjusted accordingly.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/00qXI#selection-3229.0-3281.98 [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/W1r6U [FAQ on current university and college operations]

Corona traffic light map  "On November 25th, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.   The classification for the education sector is risk level III."    Source: https://archive.vn/I1ZDL#selection-541.0-549.62 [Corona traffic light map]

*Nationwide measures*    Educational area  "Meetings for training and further education purposes may only take place for people from the same household. Otherwise, training and further training may only take place for as many people as is necessary.    "For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     "The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms.    "For further binding regulations see  COVID-19 School Ordinance 2021/22  and  COVID-19 University Act .    "From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location. Further information can be found on the website of the  Federal Ministry of Education, Science and Research (BMBWF)"    *Corona traffic light map*  On December 2nd, 2021, the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.   The classification for the education sector is risk level III.    *Coronavirus - Current Measures*     School:  â¢	School for everyone who needs it  â¢	The timetable remains upright  â¢	A mask requirement applies to all school levels in the school building as well as in class and group rooms.  â¢	However, children are allowed to stay at home without a doctor's certificate. Schools provide care and learning packages for these children.  â¢	Details can be found on the website of the Ministry of Education    Sources:  https://archive.vn/K9UCW#selection-597.0-605.62 [Corona traffic light map]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Nationwide measures  Educational area  The rules of meetings apply to extracurricular youth education, youth work and supervised holiday camps. In addition, the following applies:  â¢	Individuals may participate with a 2.5G certificate  â¢	A maximum of four supervisors per group of 25 participants is permitted.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.    For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms. If students are in the school building and do not have 2G evidence, antigen or PCR tests must be carried out at least twice a week. However, these must be carried out so often that valid evidence must be presented for each day of the teaching week.    From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location.    **Corona traffic light map**  On December 9th, 2021 the Corona Commission classifies all of Austria and all federal states as a very high risk.     The classification for the education sector is risk level III.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/C8xH8 [Corona traffic light map]

Educational area  For extracurricular youth education, youth work and supervised holiday camps, the rules of the get-togethers apply. In addition, the following applies:    Individuals may participate with a 2.5G certificate  A maximum of four supervisors per group of 25 participants is permitted.  If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  For elementary educational institutions, institutions for out-of-school childcare and child minders, there is an obligation to provide evidence of a negative PCR test twice a week. The test must not have been carried out more than 72 hours ago.     The schools are open to everyone who needs them. It is mandatory to wear a mask in the entire school building, as well as in class and group rooms. If students are in the school building and do not have 2G evidence, antigen or PCR tests must be carried out at least twice a week. However, these must be carried out so often that valid evidence must be presented for each day of the teaching week.    For further binding regulations see  COVID-19 School Ordinance 2021/22  and its  amendments   as well as  COVID-19 Higher Education Act .    From week 38, the Corona Commission will determine the epidemiological risk for the educational institutions per federal state. On the basis of this classification, the Education Directorate determines the risk level for the federal state in agreement with the central office by ordinance. The responsible education directorate then informs the schools. Defined framework conditions also enable flexible measures to be taken at the school location. Further information can be found on the website of the  Federal Ministry of Education, Science and Research (BMBWF).    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217202434/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

At work (nationwide guidelines)  â¢	Employees, owners and operators are only allowed to enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. Contacts within the meaning of the first sentence do not include a maximum of two physical contacts per day that take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	A 2G rule generally applies to employees of night-time catering establishments and major events (from 250 participants) at the workplace. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can also be presented, in which case an FFP2 mask must also be worn.  â¢	Workplaces in the health and care sector may only be entered with a 2G certificate. In retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled as well as in hospitals and health resorts and other places where health services are provided, in addition to the 2G proof, it is also compulsory to wear mouth and nose protection in closed rooms. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can also be presented; an FFP2 mask must also be worn here.    Customer areas  â¢	Customers may only enter customer areas of business premises for the purpose of purchasing goods or using services if they have 2G evidence (exceptions to the point of exit regulation or the 5th COVID-19 Protective Measures Ordinance ).  â¢	When entering and driving in the customer area of business premises, as well as the connecting structures of structurally connected business premises (e.g. shopping centers, market halls), customers must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.  â¢	The operator of business premises for the use of body-friendly services is only allowed to let customers in if they can present proof of 2G. The customer must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.    In Vienna  â¢	For all places of professional activity in Vienna, in addition to the nationwide measures, a 2.5G proof (PCR test max. 48 hours old) applies.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/WYxDd#selection-1977.0-2045.91 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/FID4b {Vienna]

At work  â¢	Employees, owners and operators are only allowed to enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. Contacts within the meaning of the first sentence do not include a maximum of two physical contacts per day that take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	For employees of night-time catering establishments and of major events (from 250 participants: inside) a 2G rule generally applies at the workplace. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can also be presented, in which case an FFP2 mask must also be worn. (Exception: operators: inside, employees may, as an exception, admit an authorized body with a negative antigen test, provided that no negative PCR test can be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely. This also applies accordingly to the operators: Inside).  â¢	Workplaces in the health and care sector may only be entered with a 2G certificate. In old people's and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled as well as in hospitals and spa facilities and other places where health services are provided, in addition to the 2G proof, it is also mandatory to wear mouth and nose protection in closed rooms. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can also be presented; an FFP2 mask must also be worn here. (Exception: operators: inside, employees may, as an exception, admit an authorized body with a negative antigen test, provided that no negative PCR test can be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely. At work  â¢	The professional activity should preferably take place outside the workplace, if this is possible and both employer: in and employee: in agree.  â¢	Employees, owners and operators may only enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they present 3G evidence. This also applies to operators.  â¢	Workplaces in the health and care sector may only be entered with 2G evidence and an additional negative PCR test. In retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled as well as in hospitals and health resorts and other places where health services are provided, wearing an FFP2 mask in closed rooms is also mandatory. (Exception: Operator: inside, employees may, as an exception, also let in with a negative antigen test from an authorized body, provided that no negative PCR test can be presented due to lack of availability or an evaluation that is not timely. This also applies accordingly to the operator: Inside).    Customer areas  â¢	Business premises of the trade, body-related services and leisure or cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered. The exception is the collection of pre-ordered goods, whereby an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered with 2G proof.  â¢	There are exceptions for business premises for daily needs, such as pharmacies, grocery stores, banks, petrol stations, etc.  â¢	Entering the customer area of business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask due to the nature of the service, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Leisure, sport and culture    Leisure  Leisure facilities (such as leisure and amusement parks, baths, dance schools, facilities for practicing prostitution, animal parks, etc.) are closed.    Culture and culture  Art and cultural institutions (museums, art halls, cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries, archives, theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas) are closed.    Sports  â¢	Indoor sports facilities are closed (exceptions: outdoor sports facilities, top athletes, disabled sports, professional athletes and their supervisors and trainers as well as representatives of the media).  â¢	Outdoor sports facilities are open, whereby the exercise of sports may only take place with people who live in the same household, the partner who does not live in the same household, individual closest relatives such as parents, children and siblings or individual important caregivers.  â¢	Top athletes:  	o	When top athletes practice sport, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  	o	Top athletes, as well as their supervisors and trainers, have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out.  	o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection.    Gastronomy and accommodation    Gastronomy  â¢	The catering is closed.  â¢	(Exceptions are catering establishments in hospitals and health resorts, old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people and companies for people who are exclusively cared for, accommodated or not staying there for mere visits).  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement for customers. Furthermore, the consumption of food and drinks is not permitted in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and may only be consumed while sitting at the dispensing stations. Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	With the FFP2 mask, it is permitted to collect food and non-alcoholic beverages as well as alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially available sealed containers.    Accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) are closed.  â¢	(Exceptions, the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility, as well as for pupils for the purpose of attending school and students Study purposes).  â¢	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force or for whom in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation, an exception can be made.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies. This also applies accordingly to the operators: Inside).    Customer areas  â¢	Business premises of the trade, body-related services and leisure or cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered. The exception is the collection of pre-ordered goods, whereby an FFP2 mask must be worn. In addition, retail outlets may not be open longer than 7 p.m.  â¢	Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered with 2G proof.  â¢	There are exceptions for operating facilities for daily needs such as pharmacies, grocery stores, banks, (electricity) filling stations, etc.  â¢	Entering the customer area of business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If, due to the nature of the service, the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Gastronomy and accommodation    Gastronomy  â¢	The catering is closed.  â¢	(Exceptions are catering establishments in hospitals and health resorts, old people's and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people and companies for people who are exclusively cared for, accommodated or not staying there for mere visits).  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement for customers. Furthermore, the consumption of food and drinks is not permitted in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point and may only be consumed while sitting at the dispensing stations. Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be minimized through special hygienic precautions.  â¢	With the FFP2 mask, it is permitted to collect food and alcohol-free beverages as well as alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially available sealed containers.    Accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) are closed.  â¢	(Exceptions, the purpose of looking after and providing assistance to people in need of support, professional reasons that cannot be postponed, satisfying an urgent need for housing, spa guests or patients and their accompanying persons in a spa or rehabilitation facility, as well as for pupils for the purpose of attending school and students Study purposes).  â¢	Persons who were already in accommodation at the time this provision came into force or for whom in advance with the accommodation provider: in the agreed period of accommodation, an exception can be made.  â¢	When entering the FFP2 mask requirement applies.    Leisure, sport and culture    Leisure  Leisure facilities (such as leisure and amusement parks, baths, dance schools, facilities for practicing prostitution, animal parks, etc.) are closed.    Culture and culture  Art and cultural institutions (museums, art halls, cultural exhibition halls, libraries, libraries, archives, theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas) are closed.    Sport  â¢	Indoor sports facilities are closed (exceptions: outdoor sports facilities, top athletes, disabled sports, professional athletes and their supervisors and trainers as well as representatives of the media).  â¢	Outdoor sports facilities are open, but sports may only be practiced with people who live in the same household, the partner who does not live in the same household, individual closest relatives such as parents, children and siblings or individual important caregivers. Lingering in the sports facility is limited to the duration of the exercise.  o	Only sports without physical contact may be practiced.  o	In non-public sports facilities, only people with a 2G certificate have access.  o	Closed areas of the sports facility may only be entered if this is necessary for outdoor sports.  â¢	Top athletes:  o	When top athletes practice sports, the responsible doctor must develop a COVID-19 prevention concept and monitor compliance with it on an ongoing basis.  o	Top athletes, as well as their supervisors and trainers, have to show a 3G certificate for training and competitions if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out.  o	If a SARS-CoV-2 infection becomes known to an athlete, supervisor or trainer, all athletes, supervisors and trainers must undergo a molecular biological test or an antigen test for the presence of a SARS-CoV- 2 to undergo infection.      *Coronavirus - Current Measures*    Place of professional activity:  â¢ General home office recommendation, federal employees also work from home    Customer areas, trade & services:  â¢ Business premises of the trade as well as body-related services, leisure facilities and cultural facilities are not allowed to be entered.  â¢ Customer areas for services that are not close to the body may only be entered upon presentation of a 2-G certificate. Customers also have to wear a mask. If this is not possible due to the nature of the service, other suitable protective measures must be taken to minimize the risk of infection.  â¢ Exceptions are permanent establishments of the universal service. Only goods may be offered that correspond to the typical range of goods at the business premises. Here customers have to wear an FFP 2 mask, for example :  	o	public pharmacies  	o	Grocery retailers and farm direct marketers  	o	Drug stores and drug stores  	o	Banks  	o	Gas stations  â¢ The opening times of the retail outlets that sell goods are limited to 7 p.m.    Gastronomy:  â¢ Gastronomy facilities may only be entered for the collection of food and alcohol-free alcoholic beverages that are filled in commercially closed containers. A mask must be worn here. Consumption is not permitted within a 50 m radius .  â¢ Take away from restaurants is still possible all day.  â¢ Advent and Christmas markets are currently not allowed to take place.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Nationwide measures    At work  â¢	The professional activity should preferably take place outside the workplace, if this is possible and both employer: in and employee: in agree.  â¢	Employees, owners and operators may only enter workplaces where physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out if they have a 3G certificate. (A maximum of two physical contacts per day, which take place outdoors and each do not last longer than 15 minutes, are not considered to be contacts).  â¢	An FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	The owner of a place of work with more than 51 employees must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	With regard to the wearing of a mask and the submission of evidence of a low epidemiological risk, stricter regulations that go beyond this ordinance can be provided in justified cases.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators. resorts, retirement and nursing homes as well as inpatient residential facilities for the disabled, facilities for the care and accommodation of children and young people, including schools and elementary educational facilities and companies, if these are used exclusively by employees or people who work there .  â¢	Self-service is permitted, provided that the risk of infection can be with an FFP2 mask, regardless of the 2G proof.    accommodation  â¢	Accommodation establishments (including campsites and shelters) may only be entered with a 2G certificate.  â¢	When entering the rehabilitation facility.  â¢	Exceptions apply to schoolchildren for the purpose of attending school and students for study purposes.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and Measures for the entire federal state of Upper Austria    Trade and public fairs; Leisure and cultural facilities  â¢	Trade and public fairs are prohibited.  â¢	2G proof for customers in all cultural institutions.  â¢	Meetings in event venues only if they are held all year round and regularly.    Meetings  â¢	Meetings are prohibited (with the exception of: club activities, facilities for adult education and for sports, funerals, assemblies, extracurricular youth education, meetings in the context of top-class or professional sports events, provided that structural and organizational measures in the sports facility are ensured).     Markets and Occasional Markets  â¢	FFP2 mask compulsory for all persons on the entire site.  â¢	It is forbidden to consume food and beverages anywhere on the site. Measures for the entire federal state of Upper Austria    Meetings  â¢	Meetings are prohibited (with the exception of: club activities, facilities for adult education and sports, funerals, assemblies, extracurricular youth education, meetings in the context of events of top-class or professional sport, provided that structural and organizational measures in the sports facility are ensured). Stay at home requirements, closing of event facilities (entertainment, amusement or recreation) as part of the 5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance are in place, in effect covering all events. All-day exit restrictions apply - essentially preventing public events.  Exceptions are in place (for example demonstrations "Assemblies according to the assembly law")    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Meetings  Generally:  â¢	Organizers have to collect contact details.  â¢	Organizers have to appoint a: n COVID-19 officer: n and draw up a COVID-19 prevention concept.  Indoor without assigned seats:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	An FFP2 mask is required.  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family reunions, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.)  Indoor with assigned seats:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	There is an FFP2 mask requirement, also at the seat.  â¢	Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people  Outdoor with no assigned seating:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 300 people  Outdoor with assigned seating:  â¢	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  â¢	Obligation to notify from 50 people  â¢	Authorization required from 250 people  â¢	Maximum limit: max. 4,000 people    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217201842/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html

Meetings  In general:  â¢	Meetings with more than 25 participants are only permitted under the condition that the person responsible for the meeting only lets the participants in if they can present proof of 2G.  â¢	Meetings of 50 people or more are notifiable. The participants must show proof of 2G, which must be checked by those responsible. He must also develop and implement a prevention concept and appoint a COVID-19 officer.  â¢	Meetings of 250 people or more must be approved. The 2G rule also applies here. A prevention concept and the appointment of a COVID-19 officer is required.  â¢	For funerals that take place in closed rooms and in which more than 50 people participate, FFP2 masks apply. An FFP2 mask requirement, however, does not apply if all those present show proof of 2G.  â¢	For specialist and public fairs, as well as occasional markets (including Advent and Christmas markets), the regulations governing get-togethers apply. The organizers have to appoint a COVID-19 officer and work out and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept. An FFP2 mask is required for customers when entering and driving in other customer areas as well as the connecting structures of structurally connected operating facilities in closed rooms.  â¢	Leaving their own private living area and staying outside their own private living area for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings for people who do not have a 2G certificate:  o	Funerals  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity  o	meetings of political bodies that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act  o	Driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles  o	Rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition, extracurricular youth education and youth work, supervised holiday camps, meetings in top-class sport    Source:  https://archive.vn/WYxDd [Nationwide measures]

'Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings' - so in effect gatherings are restricted to those in the private living space for most citizens.    Meetings  â¢	Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings:  o	Funerals  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity  o	meetings of organs of political persons cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act  o	Meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, to fulfill the necessary integration measures according to the Integration Act and for final professional examinations, if it is not possible to hold them in digital form  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups  If not all participants have a 2G certificate at these gatherings, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	The following applies to meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition:  o	 the 3G rule, when physical contact with other people cannot be excluded.  o	In addition, the person responsible for the meeting must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service, as well as for other meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Other exceptions for meetings:  o	Elite sport.  o	Driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles.  o	rehearsals and artistic performances in a fixed composition without an audience, which are carried out for professional purposes.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/lFJFe [5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance]  https://archive.vn/00qXI [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

In general, gatherings are kept to those within the household as exit restrictions are in place.  However there are exceptions:    Meetings  â¢	Leaving your own private living space for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings:  o	Funerals  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity  o	meetings of organs of political persons cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act  o	Meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, for the fulfillment of necessary integration measures according to the Integration Act and for final professional examinations, if it is not possible to hold them in digital form  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  If not all participants have a 2G certificate at these gatherings, an FFP2 mask must be worn.  â¢	The following applies to meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition:  o	 the 3G rule, when physical contact with other people cannot be excluded.  o	In addition, the person responsible for the meeting must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service, as well as for other meetings for absolutely necessary vocational training and further education purposes, the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Other exceptions for meetings:  o	Elite sport.  o	Driving in theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles.  o	rehearsals and artistic performances in a fixed composition without an audience, which are carried out for professional purposes.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Meetings  â¢	Leaving one's own private living area for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings without 2G proof:  o	Funerals,  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law,  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity,  o	meetings of organs of political persons that cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act,  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups,  o	driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles,  o	picking up food and drinks (see paragraph on gastronomy),  o	Meetings in top sport and  o	Meetings for extracurricular youth work.  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  â¢	A mask must be worn in closed rooms. This also applies to meetings outdoors.  â¢	Meetings can only take place between 5:00 am and 11:00 pm.  â¢	For meetings of more than 50 people, the organizers must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  without  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family reunions, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  with  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people  â¢	Outdoor gatherings:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: a maximum of 300 people without assigned seats and a maximum of 4,000 people with assigned seats  â¢	This also applies to specialist and public fairs as well as to occasional markets (e.g. Advent markets). In the case of occasional markets that offer goods, food or drinks for sale, a 2G verification requirement and an FFP2 mask requirement apply in closed rooms.  â¢	If there are more than 50 participants, the 2G rule and the recording of contact data do not apply to gatherings of a maximum of four people from fewer than three households plus six underage children of these people and minors for whom these people perform existing supervisory duties.  â¢	For meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition, the following also applies:  o	In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.   o	If a mask cannot be worn due to the activity, other suitable protective measures must be taken to minimize the risk of infection.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the Public Employment Service (initial and advanced training, retraining and retraining as well as reintegration into the labor market, final professional exams), the 3G certificate applies if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures and wearing an FFP2 mask. If it is not possible to wear a mask due to the nature of the training or the integration measure of people, the risk of infection must be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Meetings  â¢	Leaving one's own private living area for the purpose of attending meetings is only permitted for the following meetings without 2G proof:  o	Funerals,  o	Assemblies according to the assembly law,  o	Meetings for professional purposes, if these are necessary to maintain the professional activity,  o	meetings of organs of political persons that cannot be postponed if they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings of bodies of legal persons that cannot be postponed, provided that they cannot be held in digital form,  o	meetings that cannot be postponed under the Labor Constitution Act,  o	Meetings of medical and psychosocial self-help groups,  o	driving into theaters, concert halls and arenas, cinemas, variety theaters and cabarets, if this is done with multi-lane vehicles,  o	picking up food and drinks (see paragraph on gastronomy),  o	Meetings in top sport and  o	Meetings for extracurricular youth work.  â¢	Personal assistance and 24-hour care are not included in the maximum number of people or households.  â¢	A mask must be worn in closed rooms. This also applies to meetings outdoors.  â¢	Meetings are only allowed between 5:00 am and 11:00 pm.  â¢	For meetings of more than 50 people, the organizers must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept. This does not apply to meetings in private living quarters.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  without  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Maximum limit: max. 25 people (including family get-togethers, birthday parties, wedding parties, Christmas parties, etc.  â¢	For meetings in closed rooms and  with  assigned seats:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: max. 2,000 people  â¢	Outdoor gatherings:  o	Access is only permitted with valid 2-G proof.  o	Obligation to notify from 50 people  o	Authorization required from 250 people  o	Maximum limit: a maximum of 300 people without assigned seats and a maximum of 4,000 people with assigned seats  â¢	This also applies to specialist and public fairs as well as to occasional markets (e.g. Advent markets). In the case of occasional markets that offer goods, food or drinks for sale, a 2G verification requirement and an FFP2 mask requirement apply in closed rooms.  â¢	If there are more than 50 participants, the 2G rule and the recording of contact data do not apply to gatherings of a maximum of four people from fewer than three households plus six underage children of these people and minors for whom these people perform existing supervisory duties.  â¢	For meetings for rehearsals for professional purposes and for professional artistic performance in a fixed composition, the following also applies:  o	In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.   o	If a mask cannot be worn due to the activity, the risk of infection must be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	For meetings within the framework of the labor market service (training and further education, etc.), FFP2 mask requirements as well as 3G proof apply if physical contact cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures. If it is not possible to wear a mask due to the nature of the training or the integration measures of people, the risk of infection must be minimized by means of suitable protective measures.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20211217202434/https://corona-ampel.gv.at/aktuelle-massnahmen/bundesweite-massnahmen/

An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using taxis and taxi-like companies, school transports, cable cars and rack-and-pinion railways, mass transportation and the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.  The following applies to the use of cable cars and cogwheel railways:  â¢	The operator may only let people in if they can show proof of 2G. The person must keep this proof available for the duration of the stay.  â¢	People who use the cable car or cog railway to cover basic needs of daily life do not have to provide proof of 2G, but wear an FFP2 mask.  â¢	The operator of cable cars and cog railways has to appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.  The following applies to the use of coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic:  â¢	The operator may only let people in if they can show proof of 2G. The person must keep this proof available for the duration of the stay.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Source:  https://archive.vn/WYxDd [Nationwide measures]

Exit regulation  For people who do not have 2G proof, leaving their own private living area (including residential units in accommodation establishments as well as in old people's, nursing and handicapped homes) and staying outside their own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:  1.	Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property.  2.	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfilment of family duties.  3.	Covering the basic needs of daily life.  4.	professional and educational purposes.  5.	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household, life partners who do not live in the common household, individual closest relatives (parents, children and siblings), individual important caregivers.  6.	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  7.	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  8.	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, ..).    Source:  https://archive.vn/WYxDd [Nationwide measures]

Exit regulation  All-day exit restrictions apply. Leaving your own private living area and staying outside your own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:  â¢	Avoidance of immediate danger to life, limb and property.  â¢	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties.  â¢	Covering the necessary basic needs of daily life, such as contact with the partner who does not live in the same household, individual close relatives (parents, children and siblings) and important reference persons, the supply of basic goods of daily life, the use of health services, the coverage a need for housing, the satisfaction of basic religious needs, as well as the care of animals.  â¢	professional and educational purposes.  â¢	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household or people for physical and mental relaxation.  â¢	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  â¢	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  â¢	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, etc.).    Sources:  https://archive.vn/lFJFe [5th COVID-19 Emergency Measures Ordinance]  https://archive.vn/00qXI [Nationwide measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

"Exit restrictions:  â¢  All day exit restrictions  â¢  Exceptional reasons for leaving your own private living area are:      â Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property      â Care and help for people in need of support as well as the exercise of family rights and the fulfillment of family duties      â Covering the basic needs of daily life:           â¢ Necessary errands of daily life,           â¢ Contact with individual close relatives, important caregivers or the partner who does not live in the household           â¢ Health care including the way to the corona vaccination and testing for  SARS-CoV-2           â¢ Covering basic religious needs           â¢ Animal care & veterinary visits      â Professional and educational purposes, if necessary      â Stay outdoors for physical and mental relaxation      â Perception of administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed      â Participation in elections provided by law      â Entering certain customer areas      â To attend certain meetings, such as , inter alia, funerals and demonstrations."    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Nationwide measures    Exit regulation  There are no all-day exit restrictions for people with a 2G certificate, only a curfew from 11 p.m. for restaurants. Children under the age of 12 are exempt from the exit restrictions.    All-day exit restrictions apply to people without 2G proof. Leaving one's own private living area (including residential units in accommodation establishments, retirement and nursing homes, stationary residential facilities for the disabled) and staying outside one's own private living area is only permitted for the following purposes:  â¢	Avoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property.  â¢	Care of and assistance for people in need of support as well as exercise of family rights and fulfillment of family duties.  â¢	Covering the necessary basic needs of daily life, such as in particular  o	the contact with the partner who does not live in the same household, individual close relatives (parents, children and siblings) and important reference persons, whereby a household may only meet one other person from a second household,  o	the supply of basic goods of daily life,  o	the use of health services,  o	the coverage of a housing requirement,  o	the satisfaction of basic religious needs,  o	as well as the care of animals.  â¢	professional and educational purposes.  â¢	Staying outdoors alone, with people from the common household or people for physical and mental relaxation.  â¢	to pursue administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed.  â¢	to participate in elections provided by law and to use the instruments of direct democracy provided by law.  â¢	for the purpose of entering customer areas of certain business premises, such as pharmacies, grocery stores, drugstores, health and care services, petrol stations, banks, postal service providers, car and bicycle workshops, picking up pre-ordered meals, etc.).  â¢	Participation in certain gatherings, e.g. extracurricular youth education, top-class sport, etc.    **Coronavirus - Current Measures**    Exit restrictions  Persons without a valid 2-G certificate:  â¢	â¢All day exit restrictions  â¢	â¢Exceptional reasons for leaving your own private living area are:  o	âAvoidance of an immediate danger to life, limb and property  o	âCare and help for people in need of support as well as the exercise of family rights and the fulfillment of family duties  o	âCovering the basic needs of daily life:  ?	â¢necessary errands of daily life,  ?	â¢Contact with individual close relatives, important caregivers or the partner who does not live in the household  ?	â¢Health care including the way to the corona vaccination and testing for SARS-CoV-2  ?	â¢Covering basic religious needs  ?	â¢Animal care & veterinary visits  o	âProfessional and educational purposes, if necessary  o	âStay outdoors for physical and mental relaxation  o	âPerception of administrative or judicial processes that cannot be postponed  o	âParticipation in elections provided by law  o	âEntering certain customer areas  o	âTo attend certain gatherings, such as funerals or demonstrations    People with a valid 2-G certificate  There is a curfew from 11 p.m. for gastronomy.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Entry from states and areas with a low epidemiological risk (Annex 1) with a 2.5 G certificate.  Entry from virus variant areas and states (Appendix 2) "States and areas with a high incidence of virus variants are listed in Appendix 2 . In general, you are banned from entering Austria with only a few exceptions.  No states or areas are currently listed on Appendix 2."    Regulations for entering Austria  The 7th amendment of the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 comes into force on November 22nd . It brings the following innovations for entry into Austria:  â¢	When entering the country, a 2.5 G certificate is generally required,  â¢	Antigen and antibody tests lose their validity as evidence. Exceptions are:    o	Commuters: inside (work, school / study, family purposes, life partner: in): You need a 3-G certificate .  o	People who are subject to compulsory schooling: The ninja pass is valid as proof of a low epidemiological risk. This applies in the week in which the test intervals are adhered to, also on the Friday, Saturday and Sunday of this week and (if testing is ensured immediately after entry) on the Monday of the following week  â¢	The previously privileged duration of PCR tests of 7 days for commuters will be shortened to a validity of 72 hours. Antigen tests are only valid for 24 hours.  â¢	Vaccination certificate:  o	The minimum interval between vaccinations against the coronavirus must be 14 days.  o	The period of validity of the vaccination certificate will be shortened. The proof is only valid for 9 months, with a transition period until December 6th.    Sources:   https://web.archive.org/web/20211125164101/https://www.sozialministerium.at/Informationen-zum-Coronavirus/Coronavirus---Aktuelle-Ma%C3%9Fnahmen.html  https://archive.vn/sM8jr [FAQ : Entry into Austria]  https://archive.vn/VdXdq [quarantine requirement specifics]  https://archive.vn/Hu6NG [Entry Regulations for Austria - Austria.info]

Regulations for entering Austria  The 8th amendment to the COVID-19 Entry Ordinance 2021 comes into force on November 27th . Due to the new virus variant Omicron, there is a tightening of the entry into Austria:  â¢	Classification of the following countries as virus variant areas ("Appendix 2 of the Entry Regulation "):  Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, Zimbabwe, South Africa  â¢	Entry from these countries is generally prohibited  â¢	Essentially, only Austrian citizens and people with a place of residence or habitual abode in Austria are allowed to enter the country. Entry for humanitarian reasons or in the urgent interest of the republic is also possible. There are also a few other exceptions.  â¢	The following rules apply to these people upon entry:  o	Registration for pre-travel clearance at https://entry.ptc.gv.at/  o	Presentation of a negative molecular biological test result ( PCR test); the sampling must not be more than 72 hours ago  o	Immediate start of a ten-day quarantine. The quarantine is deemed to have ended if a further PCR test is carried out at the earliest on the fifth day after entry , the result of which is negative. The day of entry is to be regarded as "day zero".  â¢	 In addition, flights from these seven African countries will be banned from landing.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/QppwY [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://web.archive.org/web/20211129210334/https://www.ris.bka.gv.at/Dokumente/BgblAuth/BGBLA_2021_II_492/BGBLA_2021_II_492.html [492. Ordinance of the Federal Minister for Social Affairs, Health, Care and Consumer Protection on the landing ban of aircraft from SARS-CoV-2 virus variant areas and states]

Botswana  Eswatini  Lesotho  Mozambique  Namibia  Zimbabwe  South Africa    Source: https://archive.vn/rqlaA

Clearance and mouth and nose protection  When entering public places in closed rooms, an FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must be worn.   Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 may also wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device.  A distance of 2 meters should be kept to people outside the household.    *Upper Austria. COVID-19 Measures Accompanying Ordinance 2021*  For the federal state of Upper Austria, the following additional, stricter measures will apply from November 15 (until December 5):  Expansion of the FFP2 mask requirement  â¢	In coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic.  â¢	Customers in establishments of the hospitality industry if they are not at the administration point.  â¢	Guests of accommodation establishments in generally accessible areas.  â¢	Places of occupational activity, provided that physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out and the risk of infection cannot be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	Markets and occasional markets, also outdoors.  means of transport  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement and 2G proof for coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic.  Hospitality  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement for customers from the first time they enter until they are seated at the administration point. When leaving the administration area, there is a one-meter distance to other people and an FFP2 mask is mandatory.  â¢	Consumption of food and drinks only while seated at the dispensing point and not in the immediate vicinity of the dispensing point.  â¢	Administration areas are to be set up in such a way that there is a distance of at least one meter between the groups of visitors. This does not apply if the risk of infection can be minimized through suitable protective measures for spatial separation.  â¢	The 2G rule applies to the consumption of food and drinks at snack bars and catering stands.  â¢	The night catering is closed.  Accommodation establishments  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement in generally accessible areas for guests.  Meetings  â¢	Meetings are prohibited (with the exception of: club activities, facilities for adult education and sports, funerals, assemblies, extracurricular youth education, meetings in the context of events of top-class or professional sport, provided that structural and organizational measures in the sports facility are ensured).  Trade and public fairs; Leisure and cultural facilities  â¢	Trade and public fairs are prohibited.  â¢	2G proof for customers in all cultural institutions.  â¢	Meetings in event venues only if they are held all year round and regularly.  Places of professional activity  â¢	FFP2 mask requirement if physical contact with other people cannot be ruled out and the risk of infection cannot be minimized by other suitable protective measures.  â¢	2.5G proof for employees, owners and operators in restaurants, hotels and leisure and cultural facilities (comes into force on December 5, 2021) .   Markets and Occasional Markets  â¢	FFP2 mask compulsory for all persons on the entire site.  â¢	It is forbidden to consume food and beverages anywhere on the site.    *Burgenland COVID-19 Measures Accompanying Ordinance 2021*  From November 17, 2021, an additional FFP2 mask is mandatory:  â¢	in coaches and excursion boats in occasional traffic.  â¢	for customers while using body-friendly services.  â¢	For customers: inside all types of establishments in the hospitality industry (the mask may be removed while sitting at the administration point. The mask may only be removed while standing for the purpose of consuming food and beverages).  â¢	for guests in generally accessible areas in accommodation establishments (in particular lobby, reception, corridors, elevators, staircases).  â¢	for customers of leisure and cultural institutions. This does not apply in wet areas and for activities that correspond to the purpose of the facility and are associated with physical exertion.  â¢	for participants in trade and public fairs in closed rooms. In addition, food and drinks may only be consumed at the administration point.    *Measures for the entire federal state of Lower Austria*  NÃ COVID-19 Measures Accompanying Ordinance 2021  From November 17, 2021 (until December 15, 2021) an additional FFP2 mask is required:  â¢	In the hospitality industry, with the exception of lingering at the administration point. This does not apply to the administration and consumption of food and drinks outdoors.  â¢	In the interiors of cultural institutions, in particular theaters, cinemas, variety theaters, cabarets, concert halls and arenas.      Sources  : https://archive.vn/00qXI#selection-1477.0-1551.70 [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/pQOtk [Upper Austria]  https://archive.vn/t9WjJ  [Burgenland]  https://archive.vn/UYpxp [Lower Austria]

Clearance and mouth and nose protection  When entering public places in closed rooms, an FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must be worn.     Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 may also wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device.    A distance of 2 meters should be kept to people outside the household.    An FFP2 mask must be worn in closed rooms when using cable cars and cog railways, mass transportation and the associated stations, platforms, stops, train stations and airports as well as their respective connecting structures.    Entering the customer area of ??business premises is only permitted for customers with an FFP2 mask. If, due to the nature of the service, the customer cannot wear an FFP2 mask, this is only permitted if the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    At work an FFP2 mask should be worn if physical contact with people cannot be ruled out or the risk of infection can be minimized by other suitable protective measures.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Coronavirus - Current Measures    Mask requirement  An FFP2 mask is compulsory in all closed rooms. This also applies at the workplace (unless other suitable protective devices are available).    Distance obligation  There is no prescribed minimum distance to people from another household. However, it is recommended that people outside the household be kept at a distance of 2 meters.    Nationwide measures    Clearance and mouth and nose protection  When entering public places in closed rooms, an FFP2 mask or a mask with at least an equivalent standardized standard must be worn.   Children up to the age of 6 do not have to wear an FFP2 mask or an MNS. Children from the age of 6 up to the age of 14 may also wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device. Pregnant women are also allowed to wear an MNS or a close-fitting mechanical protective device.  A mask must be worn when vehicles are used jointly by people who do not live in the same household.  A distance of 2 meters should be kept to people outside the household.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled    It is forbidden to enter retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled.  â¢	Exceptions:  o	Residents  o	People who are required to care for the residents or to operate the facility,  o	Visits as part of palliative and hospice support, pastoral care and support in critical life events,  o	Visits with a maximum of two people per resident per day,  o	In addition, a maximum of two people per resident in need of support per day, if they perform regular support and care tasks,  o	an additional maximum of two people per day to accompany underage residents of inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  o	external service providers, legally defined representatives, bodies of care supervision or members of established commissions.   â¢	Residents should wear an FFP2 mask in places that are generally accessible and not part of the living area.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  â¢	The  planned measures must not be disproportionate or lead to unreasonable hardship.    The following applies to visitors:  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they can show proof of 2G and also have a negative PCR test that was not accepted more than 72 hours ago. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	The visitor or the accompanying person must have this proof available for the duration of the stay.  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear an FFP2 mask at all times during the visit or stay.    The following applies to employees:   â¢	The operator is only allowed to let employees in if they show proof of 2G. Alternatively, a valid PCR test can be presented. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.    The following applies to operators:  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled may only let residents in for new admission if they can present a 2.5G certificate.  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes must offer the residents an antigen test for SARS-CoV-2 or a molecular-biological test for SARS-CoV-2 at least every three days if they have left the home within this period.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/5GEjm [Coronavirus - Current Measures]  https://archive.vn/gYge1 [Nationwide measures]

Retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled  Entering old people's and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled is only permitted under certain conditions:  â¢	Visitors: indoor limit: a maximum of two visits per resident and day are permitted,  o	an additional maximum of two people per day to accompany underage residents of inpatient residential facilities for the disabled  o	In addition, a maximum of two people per resident in need of support per day if they perform regular support and care tasks. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  o	Exceptions: visits as part of palliative and hospice support, pastoral care and support in critical life events, external service providers, legally defined representatives, bodies of care supervision or members of established commissions.   â¢	When entering retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled, residents in generally accessible places that do not belong to the living area as well as visitors and accompanying persons must wear a mask.  â¢	If it can be made credible that a negative PCR test cannot be presented due to lack of availability, an evaluation that is not timely or due to the unpredictability of the business activity to be performed, operators may exceptionally allow people in even if they have 3G evidence submit. This also applies to operators.  â¢	The planned measures must not be disproportionate or lead to unreasonable hardship.  The following applies to visitors:  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they can show proof of 2G and also have a negative PCR test, which was accepted no more than 72 hours ago. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	The operator may only let in visitors and accompanying persons if they wear an FFP2 mask at all times during the visit or stay.  The following applies to employees:   â¢	The operator is only allowed to let employees in if they show proof of 2G. If such a test cannot be presented, a valid PCR test must be presented. In the event of a positive test result, however, the patient can still be admitted if there is no more symptoms for at least 48 hours after the infection has ended and based on the medical laboratory results, in particular on the basis of a CT value> 30, it can be assumed that there is no longer any risk of infection.  â¢	Employees must wear an FFP2 mask in closed rooms.  The following applies to operators:  â¢	The operator of retirement and nursing homes as well as residential facilities for the disabled may only let residents in for new admission if they can present a 2.5G certificate.  â¢	The operator of old people's and nursing homes must offer the residents an antigen test for SARS-CoV-2 or a molecular biological test for SARS-CoV-2 at least every three days if they have left the home within this period.  â¢	The operator must appoint a COVID-19 officer and develop and implement a COVID-19 prevention concept.    Sources:  https://archive.vn/mKGBo [Nationwide measures]  https://archive.vn/XRh8n  [Coronavirus - Current Measures]

Quote: "On September 2, 2021, the Cabinet of Ministers announced that foreigners may use their COVID-19 passport (or a document confirming full vaccination against COVID-19 or immunity to COVID-19) issued abroad to enter restaurants, hotels, large shopping centers, and other facilities that require a COVID-19 passport. Quote: "Are commercial flights operating? Yes    Is public transportation operating? Yes.   Most public transportation, including the Baku Metro, reopened on May 31 for weekday operations, and resumed weekend operation beginning October 1, 2021.  Starting October 1, 2021, when traveling by mass transit (rail or road) between the cities and regions of Azerbaijan (except between Baku and Sumgayit and in the Absheron region), those 18 and over will need to have received the first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine (and after November 1, 2021, will need to have received the second dose, or have a certificate of immunity)." Quote: "Citizens and legal residents of several countries, including Austria, Bahrain, Belgium, Canada, China, Croatia, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Qatar, Russia, Serbia, Singapore, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, the UAE, the UK, and the US are allowed to travel to Azerbaijan by air without the previously required special permission provided they meet the following conditions:    All passengers over the age of 18 years must possess official documentation (i.e., COVID Passport) issued by the relevant country demonstrating that they have either been fully vaccinated against or have recovered from COVID-19, in addition to a negative result from a PCR test taken within 72 hours prior to their flight.    All passengers between the ages of 1-18 years must possess a negative result from a PCR test taken within 72 hours prior to their flight.    Authorities plan to perform periodic assessments and gradually ease entry restrictions for travelers from other locations. Returning Azerbaijani nationals require only a negative result from a PCR test taken within 72 hours prior to their flight to enter the country. For a full list of countries approved for travel and further details on requirements for entering Azerbaijan, click here.    Land and maritime borders remain closed. The only option for entry and exit is via air on a limited number of commercial and charter flights operating to and from selected destinations. "  Archive Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20211116005100/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/540751/azerbaijan-government-extends-special-quarantine-regime-through-jan-1-update-39

COVID-19 Testing    Are PCR and/or antigen tests available for U.S. citizens in Azerbaijan? Yes  If so, are test results reliably available within 72 hours? Yes  COVID-19 testing is available in Baku. Individuals are responsible for the entire cost of COVID-19 tests and the cost is in the range of 100 AZN.  The labs listed on AZALâs website are accredited by the Management Union of Medical Territorial Units (TABIB) to offer COVID-19 tests.  Test results can be available by email or text message, depending on the procedures of each individual lab.  For information on limited humanitarian exemptions to the negative COVID-19 test requirement for entry to the United States, please review the following page    https://web.archive.org/web/20211106151629/https://az.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information-for-azerbaijan/

Current economic measures in place have been extended to December 31, 2021. The five socio-economic support measures that are extended until December 31, 2021 are as follows: Temporary unemployment due to force majeure for all sectors, The simple crisis gateway right for all sectors from a loss of 65% of turnover, A monthly bonus of 25 euros for beneficiaries of integration income, a GRAPA or an ARR Financial support for rail operators (people and freight) and Maintaining the VAT rate at 6% on hydroalcoholic gel and masks    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211003171205/https://www.premier.be/fr/prolongation-ciblee-des-mesures-de-soutien-economique-jusquau-31-decembre-2021

The mask requirement now applies uniformly in all of Belgium. It is required in the following situations; in public transportation and in medical and non-medical contact occupations, stores and shopping malls; health care facilities; areas accessible to the public in companies, public buildings, court buildings; establishments for cultural, festive, sporting and recreational activities, including theaters, concert halls, cinemas, museums, indoor theme and amusement parks, indoor fitness centers and sports centers; libraries, toy and game libraries and media libraries; worship centers.     Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211115215143/https://www.commissioner.brussels/en/updates-covid-19/item/885-uniform-measures-in-belgium

The use of the facemask is now compulsory for all children above the age of 10, however, for education, communities decide whether or not to introduce compulsory masks for children under 12.    The use of the facemask is now required in the following circumstances: The Consultative Committee decided to generalise the wearing of masks, which will now be compulsory in the following situations:  in enclosed areas of public transport and organised collective transport;  for medical and non-medical professions;  in health care institutions;  in establishments and places where catering activities are organised;  in the context of events, both indoors and outdoors and regardless of the size of the event;  in shops and shopping centres;  in publicly accessible areas of companies, public administrations, etc;  in public buildings and courts;  in libraries, toy libraries and media libraries;  in publicly accessible areas of establishments in the cultural, festive, sports, recreational and event sectors;  in fitness centres;  in places of worship.    Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20211127092653/https://www.commissioner.brussels/en/updates-covid-19/item/888-covid-updates-17-11
